t: Long*p ago God spoke to our ancestors by the prophets at different times and in different ways.
In these last days, he has spoken to us by his Son. God has appointed him heir of all things and made the universe through him.

The Son is the radiance of God’s glory and the exact expression of his nature, sustaining all things by his powerful word. After making purification for sins, he sat down at the right hand of the Majesty on high.
So he became superior to the angels, just as the name he inherited is more excellent than theirs.

For*p to which of the angels did he ever say, You*ipn are*i my*i Son;*i today*iln I*i have*i become*i your*i Father,*i or*p again, I*ipn will*i be*i his*i Father,*i and*iln he*i will*i be*i my*i Son?*i
Again,*p when he brings his firstborn into the world, he says, And*ipn let*i all*i God’s*i angels*i worship*i him.*i
And*p about the angels he says: He*ipn makes*i his*i angels*i winds,*i and*iln his*i servants*i a*i fiery*i flame,*i
but*p to the Son: Your*ipn throne,*i God,*i is*iln forever*i and*i ever,*i and*iln the*i scepter*i of*i your*i kingdom*i is*iln a*i scepter*i of*i justice.*i
You*iln have*i loved*i righteousness*i and*iln hated*i lawlessness;*i this*iln is*i why*i God,*i your*i God,*i has*iln anointed*i you*i with*iln the*i oil*i of*i joy*i beyond*iln your*i companions.*i
And:*p In*ipn the*i beginning,*i Lord,*i you*iln established*i the*i earth,*i and*iln the*i heavens*i are*i the*i works*i of*i your*i hands;*i
they*iln will*i perish,*i but*i you*i remain.*i They*iln will*i all*i wear*i out*i like*i clothing;*i
you*iln will*i roll*i them*i up*i like*i a*i cloak,*i and*iln they*i will*i be*i changed*i like*i clothing.*i But*iln you*i are*i the*i same,*i and*iln your*i years*i will*i never*i end.*i
Now*p to which of the angels has he ever said: Sit*ipn at*i my*i right*i hand*i until*iln I*i make*i your*i enemies*i your*i footstool?*i
Are*p they not all ministering spirits sent out to serve those who are going to inherit salvation?
